ovdesc.p: OVERVIEW OF RE STAT LINE CHANGE
This application is used to move lines around within one specific report.
The function (I)nput (C)opy, (L)ist, (P)rint, (R)eversal. S(ee) and (V)erify are available.
The functions (I)nput and (C)opy are used to load the records into the file.
The V(erify) function is used to actually move the lines and update all associated files.
The V(erify) function can not be run while a user is updating the RE.STAT.REP.LINE file.

First stage of the Verification after verify data is in order is to back up the files. If the program fails after the back up stage then the application RE.STAT.LINE.RECOVERY is to be run to restore files. This is necessary as the number of journal record parameters could exceed maximum allowed.

desc.p: Identifies the report for which the lines are to be adjusted.
Must be an Id of a main header record in the RE.STAT.REPORT.HEAD.
Is the line number to which the last line number of the old range is to be moved.
This field number is calculated by adding difference between old field numbers to new line start number.
4 numeric characters. Multivalue associated with fields 1.1 to 3.1. Calculated field.
Is the line number to which the first line number of the old range is to be moved.
4 numeric characters. Multivalue associated with fields 1.1 and 2.1 and 4.1. Mandatory Input.
The new range, when all ranges have been entered can not overlap with another new range and/or existing lines which have not moved.
Is the last line number in the range of those to be moved.
The end of the range can be either a valid line number or End, in which case End is replaced with last actual line number on the report for processing purposes.
If a single line is to be moved then the start and end line numbers are to be equal.
4 digits Numeric or Value END. Multivalue assoicated with fields 2.1 and 3.1 and 4.1. Mandatory Input.
It must be numeric or End.
If numeric there must be a record for the line on the RE.STAT.REP.LINE.
Is the first line number in range of those lines to be moved.
4 digits numeric. Multivalued associated with fields 2.1 to 4.1. Mandatory Input.
The line number must be present for report in the RE.STAT.REP.LINE file.
